news_header: US President Donald Trump has suspended the enforcement of an anti-corruption law that allows the prosecution of Americans for bribing foreign officials.
news_original_title: Trump halts prosecution of firms accused of bribery abroad
news_text: He claims this will boost business for America and argues that the law's enforcement hinders US economic advancement. Critics, including Transparency International, warn that this move undermines efforts against global corruption. Trump has previously criticized the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and directed a review of its enforcement. The White House argues that the law creates an uneven playing field for US companies. Recent cases involving Goldman Sachs and Glencore highlight the law's implications. On the same day, Trump also directed federal prosecutors to drop a corruption case against New York City Mayor Eric Adams and pardoned former Illinois Governor Rod Blagojevich.
